sentences.sContent: Matthew coughed and cleared his throat.
sentences.sCn: 马修咳了一声清清喉咙。

sentences.sContent: I think I’m getting a cold or flu – I’ve been coughing and sneezing all day.
sentences.sCn: 我想我是着凉了，或者得了流感——我整天都在咳嗽和打喷嚏。

sentences.sContent: ...Two months ago Gullotta saw a 50-year-old ma who had delayed doing anything about his smoker’s cough for a year...

phrases.pCn: 咳出；勉强说出；[俚]被迫付出

trans.tranOther: to suddenly push air out of your throat with a short sound, often repeatedly
a medical condition that makes you cough a lot
